Patrick Morgan

Front End Developer | Music Producer

Hello!

Thanks for stopping by

Download my resume

I’m Patrick. Professionally, I'm a front-end developer focused on how design meets technology. Personally, I'm a creative person that rarely goes a day without making something. I’m also apparently very pensive when I drink coffee.

At Amex I've worked as a part of a product design team where I’ve grown from independently handling smaller projects to being the front-end technical lead for large new feature development. While my end deliverable is almost always the front-end code itself, I enjoy working throughout the entire design process. In a previous life I was a brand strategist at Leo Burnett (a global ad agency), so I still enjoy a healthy dose of strategy to pair with my hours locked in on a text editor.

If you need a technologist that's at his best on the edge of engineering and design, please look me up! I'm moving to Los Angeles in June 2016 and am looking for a new team to join.

American Express

Front End Development + UX Design

My corner of the Amex universe revolved around the prepaid debit card platform, Serve. My team was responsible for the logged-in web experience of three brands on this platform: Amex Serve, Walmart Bluebird and Target Redcard. Serve is a full-featured banking alternative not unlike the account you might have with Chase or Wells Fargo (includes bill pay, direct deposit, savings etc...). Check out the links below where I go into more depth on my routine work and three larger projects.

Want a demo? I'm happy to demo any of my code from Amex, but unfortunately I'm limited in what I can post online due to confidentiality agreements.

Tech Stack

Ya know, code and stuff

Every company has unique front-end development needs and philosophies, so let me break down what tech I've worked with at Amex and what I hope to do in my next role.

Serve Responsive Web

HTML, SCSS, Compass, JS

To better serve our largely mobile user base, we redesigned the logged-in experience to be 100% responsive and optimized for simple use across all key devices.

Amex Offers

JS, jQuery, Dust.js, API Integration

By pairing data from an existing API with new user insights, we refreshed an established American Express perk for our unique set of cardholders.

Walmart Cash Pickup

User Testing, Logic Map, Service Journey

Amex partnered with Walmart and Ria to deliver a streamlined cash pickup and money transfer experience for Bluebird and Serve customers.

General Assembly

Web Development Immersive Student

After two years as a brand strategist at Leo Burnett in Chicago, I realized I wasn't happy stopping my work at the point of deciding the strategy; I wanted to be responsible for its execution. Web development became my path toward satisfying my fundamental need to make things. So I quit my job, moved to New York and put myself through the ringer at General Assembly before finding my niche at Amex.

Please note: These are projects from my earliest days as a developer. They're fun to browse, but I've obviously learned a lot in the 2+ years since making them.

Echonest App

Musician "hotness" + popularity ranking

I'm a big music fan, so for my final project at GA I developed a simple ranking app based on data from the Echonest, a super in-depth API that now powers a lot of Spotify features.

Live From New York...

NY Times Archive Search App

My very first web app makes simple queries to the NY Times archives API. Search for your birthday! You're bound to find something interesting. Is this a great feat of engineering or design? Not by a long shot. But it's always fun to remember the humble beginnings.

Broadwaze

My music production side hustle

I've been involved with music for as long as I can remember. First came the piano lessons, then the years of choir, acappella groups and musicals and now I've honed in on music production and songwriting. So if you wanna chat about effect chains in Ableton Live, the lyric structure of that pop song you can't get out of your head or even if you just wanna have a good old fashioned jam session, I'm your man.

Check out my Soundcloud!

I heavily re-worked the Nas classic "If I Ruled The World", sampling Humphrey Bogart and his even-more-classic "Maltese Falcon".

Yeah, Jared Leto is a little cray but his music backs it up. I remixed 30 Second to Mars' "Kings and Queens" with a Tropical House vibe.

I set out to use a wobble bass and pull in some carribean vibe a la Diplo and ended up with a solid Reggaeton-esque dance beat.

Heyo. Thanks again for checking out my work.

I'm soon to be Los Angeles based, Pennsylvania-born, and always down to chat about getting projects done. Also, beer and coffee are delicious. Let's have one.
